blocks.data:
Returns a list of refunds ordered by refund ID in ascending order.

Requires at least one of the following scopes:
* `store_v2_transactions_read_only`
* `store_v2_transactions`
* `store_v2_orders_read_only`
* `store_v2_orders`

### OAuth Scopes
|  **UI Name** | **Permission** | **Parameter** |
| --- | --- | --- |
|  Order Transactions | read and modify `transactions` and `payment_methods` | `store_v2_transactions` |
|  Order Transactions | read `transactions` and `payment_methods`  | `store_v2_transactions_read_only` |
|  Orders | read and modify `payment_methods` |`store_v2_orders`|
|  Orders | read `payment_methods` |`store_v2_orders_read_only`|

### Headers

|Header|Parameter|Description|
|-|-|-|
|`X-Auth-Token`|`access_token `|Obtained by creating an API account or installing an app in a BigCommerce control panel.|

### Example

```http
GET /stores/{$$.env.store_hash}/v3/catalog/summary
host: api.bigcommerce.com
Content-Type: application/json
X-Auth-Token: {access_token}
```

* For more information on Authenticating BigCommerce APIs, see: [Authentication](https://developer.bigcommerce.com/api-docs/getting-started/authentication).
* **Name**: X-Auth-Token
* **Location**: header

order_id:in.description: Filter by `order_id`. Accepts multiple as comma-separated values.

id:in.description: Filter by refund `id`. Accepts multiple as comma-separated values.

created:min.description:
Filter results so they are later than or equal to provided date.


Must be in url-encoded RFC 3339 format.
e.g. `2020-01-15T01:02:34-01:00` is RFC 3339 format.
Url-encoded this will be `2020-01-15T01%3A02%3A34%2B01%3A00`

created:max.description:
Filter results so they are earlier than or equal to provided date.


Must be in url-encoded RFC 3339 format.
e.g. `2020-01-15T01:02:34-01:00` is RFC 3339 format.
Url-encoded this will be `2020-01-15T01%3A02%3A34%2B01%3A00`

page.description: Specifies the page number in a limited (paginated) list of items.

limit.description: Controls the number of items per page in a limited (paginated) list of items.

user_id.description: Reference to the user's id who create this refund. This is automatically populated by BigCommerce.

created.description: Timestamp of when this refund was created

total_amount.description: A non-negative 2 decimal place rounded value that represents the amount that can be charged/refunded via payment providers.
total_amount.title: Amount

total_tax.description: Total tax amount refunded back to shopper. Note: order_level_amount does not affect tax liability. This can be negative amount indicating we have collected tax by virtue of refunding less to the customer

item_type.description: Type of item that was refunded

item_id.description: order_product.id corresponding to the item_types of PRODUCT, GIFT_WRAPPING. order_address.id corresponding to the item_types of SHIPPING, HANDLING. order.id corresponding to the item_type of ORDER.

quantity.description: Quantity of item refunded. Note: this will only be populated for item_type PRODUCT

requested_amount.description: A non-negative 2 decimal place rounded value that represents the amount that can be charged/refunded via payment providers.
requested_amount.title: Amount

payments.description: An array of refund payments made to payment providers

amount.description: A non-negative 2 decimal place rounded value that represents the amount that can be charged/refunded via payment providers.
amount.title: Amount

is_declined.description: Indicate if this payment has been declined by payment provider

declined_message.description: Message indicate why payment was declined
